result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Nowak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

Recommendations by ADA Turner.
Recommendations by Atty. Lloyd.

Court sentences defendant to - 9 months County Jail - imposed/stayed (with Huber privilege) probation 2 years, with the following conditions:
 - Defendant shall pay costs of the action.
 - Defendant shall pay supervision fees.
 - Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Court advises defendant of appeal rights, firearm warning, and voter restriction.
